name: Pediatric Primary Tumor
title: Pediatric Primary Tumor
subtitle: St. Jude/Murphy Staging System
notes:
**Note 1:** Extensive disease (Stage III) typically exhibits spread to para-aortic and retro-peritoneal areas by implants and plaques in mesentery or peritoneum, or by direct infiltration of structures adjacent to the primary tumor. Ascites may be present, and complete resection of all gross tumor is not possible. 

**Note 2:** Code 888 for histologies 9731, 9732, and 9734
footnotes: (1)	Aitken JF, Youlden D, O’Neill L, Gupta S, Frazier AL, eds. Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines – Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.
rows:
Involvement of a single tumor, mass, or nodal area
* EXCLUDING the following
   - GI tract (C160-C218) (see code 200)
   - Abdomen (see code 300)
   - Mediastinum (see code 300)
   - CNS (C700-C729) (see code 400)

Involvement of the GI tract (C160-C218) 
* WITHOUT lymph node involvement (see code 500 for lymph node involvement)

Involvement of a single tumor, mass, or nodal area 
* Primary intrathoracic (mediastinal, hilar, pulmonary, pleural, thymic)
* Abdominal/intraabdominal
* Paraspinal or epidural

Involvement of a single CNS tumor, mass (C700-C729)
* See code 800 if lymph node involvement

Any of the following (excluding sites listed in codes 200-400)
* Single tumor (extranodal) with regional node involvement
* Two or more nodal areas on the SAME side (either above or below) the diaphragm
* Two or more single (extranodal) tumors
   - WITH or WITHOUT regional lymph node involvement
   - AND on SAME side (either above or below) of the diaphragm

Primary gastrointestinal tract tumor (C160-C218)
* WITH involvement of associated mesenteric nodes only
   - See code 700 if additional lymph node regions involved

Any of the following with multiple tumors, extranodal site(s) WITH lymph node involvement on the SAME side (either above or below) the diaphragm
* Primary intrathoracic (mediastinal, hilar, pulmonary, pleural, thymic)
* Abdominal/intraabdominal
* Paraspinal or epidural

Tumor (extranodal) or nodal areas on BOTH sides (above and below) of the diaphragm (excluding sites C700-C729)
* Includes:
   - Gastrointestinal tumors
   - Gastrointestinal tumors
   - Primary intrathoracic (mediastinal, hilar, pulmonary, pleural, thymic)
   - Abdominal/intraabdominal
   - Paraspinal or epidural

Any of the following
* Multiple CNS tumors, or CNS tumor WITH lymph node involvement
* Cranial nerve palsy that cannot be explained by extradural lesions, OR
* Blasts morphologically identified in CSF
   - In the absence of a CSF tumor mass and cranial nerve palsy, a CSF report is required to confirm or exclude CNS involvement

AND/OR Bone marrow involvement

Not documented in medical record
St Jude Staging System not assessed

Death certificate only
